text:
Hey <@U03PCH27EAV> - I only have limited experience with HubL and it's exclusive to CMS Hub. With that disclaimer in mind, I know I was unable to pull the data I wanted from a company, where the contact record was associated with the particular company, if I used the "company_collection__contact_to_company_unlabeled" association, and when I used the "company_collection__primary" association is consistently works every time.

Might there be a different function that pulls the primary company a contact is associated with? If so, I recommend giving that a shot to see if it helps.

You don't. You'd want to use <style> tags in the module.html

The module.css section doesn't actually support much Hubl.

More on this here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#styling-based-on-module-field-values>

hi there! I am new to hubl and html integration to HubSpot templates. I am trying to set a parameter in a web url to a HubSpot contact's `hs_object_id` by doing the following:
`&tracking={{contact.hs_object_id}}` and I see that this comes back as `CONTACT.HS_OBJECT_ID` instead of the actual string value. Was wondering if anyone had any pointers or ideas to remediate this issue? Thank you!
